attributes.action: Palestinian Refugees in Lebanon over 70 years human suffering to be end.
attributes.additional_details: The UK government has the ability to exert pressure on UNRWA through parliamentary discussions, urging them to work towards a lasting resolution for Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. It is imperative that steps are taken towards achieving a sustainable solution at this time.
attributes.background: I am asking for a Parliamentary select committee to tackle the issues and encourage UNRWA to come up with a permanent solution. UNRWA is failing to provide necessary services to Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, leading to more suffering as people take dangerous boat journeys for freedom.

rejection.details: It is not clear what you would like to happen. The United Nations Relief and Works Agency is a relief agency, not one that would propose or seek a political solution to any issues in Lebanon. It's also not clear what you mean by a "permanent solution". We could accept a petition calling on the Government to urge additional support for Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, or to see some other outcome - but it would need to be clear what outcome you want the Government to work towards.
